commits.author: Steven Rowe
commits.sourceNew:
/** * Wrapping the given {@link InputStream} in a reader using a {@link CharsetDecoder}. * Unlike Java's defaults this reader will throw an exception if your it detects * the read charset doesn't match the expected {@link Charset}. *

* Decoding readers are useful to load configuration files, stopword lists or synonym files * to detect character set problems. However, its not recommended to use as a common purpose * reader. * * @param stream the stream to wrap in a reader * @param charSet the expected charset * @return a wrapping reader */ public static Reader getDecodingReader(InputStream stream, Charset charSet) { final CharsetDecoder charSetDecoder = charSet.newDecoder() .onMalformedInput(CodingErrorAction.REPORT) .onUnmappableCharacter(CodingErrorAction.REPORT); return new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(stream, charSetDecoder)); }
